main event: On July 3, 1954, a civilian in Washington, D.C. observed a round, yellow object the size of a balloon, flying in a north-west direction. The object blinked on the outer edge and emitted light twice before passing out of vision range.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of a baseball and light yellow in color, with no sound or aerodynamic features noticed.
No aircraft was noticed in the vicinity at the time of the sighting.
The source of the observation was a civilian, and the length of the observation was 2 minutes.
The UFO was initially evaluated as possibly a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical object by the U.S. Air Force.
This report was part of the Project Blue Book, a U.S. Air Force program that investigated unidentified flying objects during the 1950s.
sighted object: round, yellow object the size of a balloon
